marketNews.title: Awaiting the 2025 Provincial Minimum Wage UMP Formula
marketNews.content: The Government will announce the formula for determining the 2025 provincial minimum wage (UMP) in the near future. This formula will replace the UMP determination formula in Government Regulation No. 51/2023, which was annulled by the Constitutional Court last week as the labor cluster was removed from the Omnibus Law on Job Creation. The Vice President of the Confederation of Indonesian Workers Unions, Kahar S. Cahyono, stated that his party held a meeting with the DPR and the government on Wednesday (6/11). In the meeting, Kahar mentioned that the Ministry of Manpower proposed that the alpha variable in the UMP formula be divided based on industry type, with the alpha variable for labor-intensive industries in the range of 0.2-0.5 and capital-intensive industries around 0.2-0.8. This proposal from the Ministry of Manpower is lower than the request from the Confederation of Indonesian Workers Unions, which wanted an alpha variable around 1-1.2 to maintain community purchasing power in 2025. The alpha variable itself is a specific index representing the contribution of labor to the economic growth of the province or city/regency. In Government Regulation No. 51/2023, the alpha variable was set around 0.1-0.3, where this figure would be multiplied by economic growth before being added to the inflation rate to determine the UMP increase rate. Meanwhile, a different proposal was submitted by the President of the All Indonesia Workers Union Association, Mirah Sumirat. Mirah stated that her party proposed that the 2025 UMP determination formula should take into account future inflation and economic growth projections. Mirah also mentioned that they proposed the 2025 UMP calculation should also consider 64 items of a decent living wage component. Besides changing the UMP determination formula, the government will also re-implement the sectoral wage (UMS) which was previously removed in the Omnibus Law on Job Creation. The deadline for UMP determination falls on November 21, 2024, with the announcement schedule for regency/city minimum wages no later than November 30, 2024. Nevertheless, labor observer, Timboel Siregar, said that the government needs to postpone the deadline for the 2025 UMP determination so that discussions at the Regional Wage Council are not rushed.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Higher UMP increases, along with a larger alpha variable, potentially increase community purchasing power, thus driving consumption, which can positively impact consumer issuers such as ICBP, MYOR, and TSPC. On the other hand, higher UMP increases can suppress profitability for issuers with a high proportion of opex from employee salaries, such as ACES, AMRT, and MAPI. In addition, we also assess that the UMP increase rate needs to consider the industry's ability to survive—given the layoffs that have occurred recently—so that it does not boomerang against consumption.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Expects Retail Sales Growth in October 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia estimates that retail sales in October 2024 will grow +1% YoY, although projected to contract -0.5% MoM. Retail sales in October 2024 are expected to be supported by an increase in sales of cultural and recreational goods groups, spare parts and accessories, as well as the textile subgroup. In September 2024, realized retail sales were recorded at +4.8% YoY growth, although contracting -2.5% MoM (vs. August 2024: +5.8% YoY, +1.7% MoM) due to declining public demand following the end of various Indonesian Republic Anniversary (HUT RI) discount programs.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Government Plans to Offer Foreign Investors 75 GW of New and Renewable Energy
marketNews.content: The envoy and younger brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated that the Indonesian government plans to offer opportunities to foreign investors to build 75 GW of new and renewable energy out of a total addition of 100 GW of energy to be implemented in the next 15 years. Hashim said this additional energy includes solar, hydro, geothermal, and nuclear power, while he did not elaborate further on the energy sources for the remaining 25 GW. Indonesia's installed electricity capacity currently reaches more than 90 GW, with more than half using coal and less than 15% using new and renewable energy.

marketNews.title: Dairy Industry Urges Government to Focus on Domestic Fresh Milk Quality Amidst Import Duty Concerns
marketNews.content: The Executive Director of the Indonesian Milk Processing Industry Association, Sonny Effendhi, asked the government to focus on encouraging the quality of fresh milk produced domestically because local milk meeting standards is still scarce. Sonny also mentioned that the government's plan to impose import duties on imported milk is counterproductive because it will increase the selling price of milk products to consumers who are currently facing purchasing power challenges. According to the Deputy Minister of Cooperatives, Ferry Juliantono, the price of imported milk is cheaper by about 1,000-2,000 per liter. To encourage domestic milk absorption, Ferry stated that his party proposes incentives for domestic breeders or re-examines the potential application of import duties on imported milk. This step is a government response to the action of discarding milk production by dairy farmers last week.

marketNews.title: BEI Launches Single Stock Futures (SSF) Investment Instrument
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) launched the stock future contract investment instrument or single stock futures (SSF) today, Tuesday (12/11). SSF is a derivative product that allows investors to take a long or short position. The underlying for SSF is the constituent stocks of the LQ45 index. At the initial launch of SSF, there were 15 series of securities using 5 stocks as underlying, namely ASII, BBCA, BBRI, MDKA, and TLKM. The President Director of BEI, Iman Rachman, stated that currently, only 3 exchange members have provided SSF trading facilities.

marketNews.title: Nestle and P&G to Investigate CPO Supply Chains After Illegal Deforestation Allegations
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Nestle and Procter & Gamble (P&G) will investigate their CPO supply chains after an investigation by the environmental group, Rainforest Action Network, indicated that the companies' CPO supply originated from illegal deforestation of wild nature reserves in Indonesia. Rainforest Action Network stated that its investigation, conducted in September and October 2024, found that fresh fruit bunches from illegal plantations were sold to PT Global Sawit Semesta and PT Aceh Trumon Anugerah Kita factories, both of which supply major brands including P&G, Nestle, Mondelez, and PepsiCo. The Ministry of Forestry has not yet commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Andalan Indonesia Announces IPO Plan
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia, a subsidiary of Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO), plans to conduct an Initial Public Offering (IPO) of 778.7 million shares (10%) at a price ranging from 4,590-5,900 rupiah per share. The proceeds will be used as follows: 40% for lending to subsidiaries, 15% for partial repayment of a loan to PT Adaro Indonesia, and the remainder for partial repayment of a loan to ADRO. The public offering period is estimated to run from November 29 to December 3, 2024, with an estimated listing on the IDX on December 5, 2024. In addition to the IPO, AADI will also conduct a public offering by existing shareholders (PUPS) concurrently with the IPO process. This corporate action is part of AADI's spin-off from ADRO.

tickerNews.title: Indirect Controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, Increases Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: The indirect controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, purchased 10 million BREN shares at an average price of 7,322 rupiah per share on November 11, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 73.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BREN increased from 0.08954% to 0.09701%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA to Distribute Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to approximately 6.2 trillion rupiah or 50 rupiah per share. The cum date for the regular and negotiation market is November 20, 2024, with payment on December 11, 2024. Referring to BBCA's stock price at the close of trading on Tuesday (12/11) at 10,150 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 0.5%.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Plans to Issue Bonds and Sukuk for Working Capital
tickerNews.content: Petrosea (PTRO) plans to issue bonds worth 1 trillion rupiah and sukuk worth 500 billion rupiah, each consisting of 4 series. The interest rate has not been announced, while the proceeds are intended for working capital in mining projects as well as engineering and construction. The bonds and sukuk have each received an idA+ rating and idA+(sy) rating from Pefindo. The public offering period is estimated to take place on December 9-10, 2024.

tickerNews.title: TBS Energi Utama Announces Change in Buyback Fund Allocation Plan
tickerNews.content: TBS Energi Utama (TOBA) announced a change in the allocation plan for its share buyback funds, from a maximum of 30.8 million US dollars or 474.5 billion rupiah in the previous prospectus, to a maximum of 25.9 million US dollars or 425.5 billion rupiah. Meanwhile, the planned number of shares to be repurchased remains unchanged, which is a maximum of 816.8 million shares or 10% of the total issued and paid-up capital. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on November 14, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MNC Energy Investments Plans Rights Issue up to 20.2 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: MNC Energy Investments (IATA) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 20.2 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 44.44%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds obtained are intended for the company's working capital, including investments in subsidiaries. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on December 18, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Lippo Cikarang Plans Rights Issue up to 3 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: Lippo Cikarang (LPCK) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to 3 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 52.82%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the proceeds obtained are intended for the company's working capital and/or capital injection to subsidiaries. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on November 19, 2024.

tickerNews.title: Sumantri, Director of Rukun Raharja (RAJA), Increased Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: Sumantri, Director of Rukun Raharja (RAJA), purchased 2.5 million RAJA shares at a price of 1,355 rupiah per share on November 4, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Sumantri's ownership in RAJA increased from 0% to 0.06%.

tickerNews.title: Net Visi Media (NETV) Officially Changes Name to MDTV Media Technologies Following FILM Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Net Visi Media (NETV) officially changed its company name to MDTV Media Technologies. This decision, which was approved by shareholders at the EGM on November 7, 2024, was made after MD Entertainment (FILM) completed the acquisition of 80.05% of NETV shares at an exercise price of 50 rupiah per share on October 25 and 29, 2024.
